text:
<@UAUPJLBQX> I was going through <https://juliasimd.github.io/LoopVectorization.jl/stable/examples/matrix_multiplication/#Matrix-Multiplication|this>  example in the `LoopVectorization.jl`  documentation for matrix multiplication and I don't understand why, but it is not updating my `C` output matrix.
```N = 2
A1 = rand(N, N)
A2 = rand(N,N)
A3 = similar(A1)

function A_mul_B!(C, A, B)
    @avx for n ∈ indices((C,B), 2), m ∈ indices((C,A), 1)
        Cmn = zero(eltype(C))
        for k ∈ indices((A,B), (2,1))
            Cmn += C[m,k] * B[k,n]
        end
        C[m,n] = Cmn
    end
end

julia> A_mul_B!(A3, A1, A2)

julia> A3
2×2 Matrix{Float64}:
 6.22527e-310  9.15541e-310
 6.22543e-310  9.15553e-310```
Is this a bug?

elements.text: documentation for matrix multiplication and I don't understand why, but it is not updating my

N = 2
A1 = rand(N, N)
A2 = rand(N,N)
A3 = similar(A1)

function A_mul_B!(C, A, B)
    @avx for n ∈ indices((C,B), 2), m ∈ indices((C,A), 1)
        Cmn = zero(eltype(C))
        for k ∈ indices((A,B), (2,1))
            Cmn += C[m,k] * B[k,n]
        end
        C[m,n] = Cmn
    end
end

julia> A_mul_B!(A3, A1, A2)

julia> A3
2×2 Matrix{Float64}:
 6.22527e-310  9.15541e-310
 6.22543e-310  9.15553e-310

text:
ah yes, this line is wrong
`Cmn += A[m,k] * B[k,n]`

elements.text: ah yes, this line is wrong
